page.title: 18How villages have changed
page.content:
We looked at some Census Returns from 1881 to see how peoples's jobs in the village have changed in the last hundred years. In 1881 nearly a half of the people in the village with jobs were agricultural labourers, working on the land: the next largest number was servants, like maids, cooks, domestic servants, governesses and housekeepers. There were also carpenters, bakers, shoemakers, butchers, farmers, blacksmiths, masons and even a magistrate.
Now there are not that many people who actually work in the village. There are some farms, the school, the pub, the Church and the Post Office. Even I work in the village!
